bibl.title: The Dead Alexander and the Egyptians: Archaeology of a Void.
Alexander the Great and Egypt. History, Art, Tradition. Wrocław / Breslau, 18. / 19. Nov. 2011.

bibl.note: Suggests that the dead Alexander played no part at all in the Ptolemaic efforts of legitimising their rule within an Egyptian context and that Alexander had to play his decisive role solely in the legitimation towards the Greek people inside and outside of Egypt.
bibl.seg: Gunnar R. Dumke, The Dead Alexander and the Egyptians: Archaeology of a Void.

Volker Grieb, Krzysztof Nawotka & Agnieszka Wojciechowska (edd.), Alexander the Great and Egypt. History, Art, Tradition. Wrocław / Breslau, 18. / 19. Nov. 2011 = Philippika. Altertumskundliche Abhandlungen. 74 (Wiesbaden, 2014) pp. 337-346, 5 figg.

Suggests that the dead Alexander played no part at all in the Ptolemaic efforts of legitimising their rule within an Egyptian context and that Alexander had to play his decisive role solely in the legitimation towards the Greek people inside and outside of Egypt.
